body: Jiangtao and Julien should approve this as a change to the security code.  Also requesting review from Paul as our resident IPv6 expert.

If this raises too many eyebrows, I think a more natural option for us could be to use ULAs. I put this together before I fully realized site-locals were replaced with ULAs. But, even if we go with ULAs as our working solution, maybe this could still be beneficial?

I take that back slightly. After discussing more internally, we want to be able to diagnose problems in an environment where network configuration has potentially failed and the only option we have would be to use a link-local.
Gentle ping to @jboeuf @jiangtaoli2016 for feedback since it's been a few weeks.

JIangtao, are you taking this one or do you want me to have a look?

I can review. I was waiting for @pmarks-net to approve first.
@dcow could you please resolve conflict with master, so that I can trigger some tests?
@jiangtaoli2016 will do. I'll address @pmarks-net comment about the extraneous allocation at the same time.

In fact, some of the internal CI error was due to this nit. If you can add some unit tests, that would be great.

please run
`CLANG_FORMAT_ROOT=~/grpc tools/dockerfile/grpc_clang_format/clang_format_all_the_things.sh`
before submitting.

@jiangtaoli2016 I'm having a few issues running the tests and code formatter.

### python2.7

    $ pip install six google-api-python-client

When I run `tools/run_tests/run_tests.py` I get:

```
Unexpected error getting flaky tests: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tools/run_tests/run_tests.py", line 1421, in <module>
    for test in get_bqtest_data():
  File "tools/run_tests/run_tests.py", line 72, in get_bqtest_data
    import big_query_utils
  File "/Users/dcow/grpc/tools/gcp/utils/big_query_utils.py", line 21, in <module>
    from apiclient import discovery
ImportError: cannot import name discovery

languages with custom make options cannot be built simultaneously with other languages
```
I try:

    $ pip install discovery
    Requirement already satisfied: discovery in ...

### python3    

```
$ tools/run_tests/run_tests.py
  File "tools/run_tests/run_tests.py", line 1680
    except subprocess.CalledProcessError, e:
                                        ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

Am I missing something silly? I have not run `setup.py` because I'm not working on the python parts of the codebase. 

### clang-format

```
$ CLANG_FORMAT_ROOT=~/grpc tools/dockerfile/grpc_clang_format/clang_format_all_the_things.sh
xargs: clang-format-5.0: No such file or directory

$ clang-format -version
clang-format version 7.0.0 (tags/google/stable/2018-01-11)

brew install clang-format-5.0
Error: No available formula with the name "clang-format-5.0" 
```

Where can I get `clang-format-5.0`?

### make

    $ tools/run_tests/start_port_server.py
    $ make test 

works until my machine runs out of file descriptors.

```
...<snip>...
src/core/lib/iomgr/wakeup_fd_pipe.cc","file_line":41,"os_error":"Too many open files","syscall":"pipe"}
E0302 01:18:13.648940000 123145316081664 wakeup_fd_pipe.cc:40]         pipe creation failed (24): Too many open files
E0302 01:18:13.649005000 123145316081664 ev_poll_posix.cc:898]         pollset_work: {"created":"@1519982293.648983000","description":"OS Error","errno":24,"file":"src/core/lib/iomgr/wakeup_fd_pipe.cc","file_line":41,"os_error":"Too many open files","syscall":"pipe"}
E0302 01:18:13.649017000 123145316081664 backup_poller.cc:124]         Run client channel backup poller: {"created":"@1519982293.648983000","description":"OS Error","errno":24,"file":"src/core/lib/iomgr/wakeup_fd_pipe.cc","file_line":41,"os_error":"Too many open files","syscall":"pipe"}
E0302 01:18:13.977348000 140736349066176 sequential_connectivity_test.cc:93] assertion failed: ev.success == true



*******************************
Caught signal SIGABRT
  no backtrace
/bin/sh: line 1: 99148 Abort trap: 6           /Users/dcow/grpc/bins/opt/sequential_connectivity_test
test sequential_connectivity_test failed
```

So at least the test compiles... but I can't verify it works locally.
@jiangtaoli2016 ping. I'll have time to work on this tomorrow if you have any pointers.
@jiangtaoli2016 I ran `$ CLANG_FORMAT=clang-format ... clang_format_all_the_things.sh` but it only changed files I have not touched.

@jiangtaoli2016 my bad I ran format_all_the_things on the wrong branch. I've addressed the style issues. I'd love comments on the best approach for the tests since the function we're want to test is static.
@dcow sorry for delay. A couple of comments.

@jiangtaoli2016 I've got time this week to bring this PR to completion. Anything left that you'd like to see? I've been able to more thoroughly verify my clients behave as intended with this patch ported onto version 1.11 and applied onto the directory with my vendored grpc sources in my client codebase. I could try to get a full build working on the top of tree with this patch, if that would help. Otherwise I'm pretty confident in this patch. I'll rebase and fixup the commits and can address any additional feedback tomorrow.
@jiangtaoli2016 let me know when you're done reviewing and I will squash.
@jiangtaoli2016 I'm just going to rebase now.
@jiangtaoli2016 bump.
@markdroth are you able to ping anyone for me? I'm pretty patient but I also want to get this wrapped up.
@dcow Somehow this PR was buried in my email box without noticing it. Will merge after you change in the header file and after tests pass.
